post.body: And posting here, on Dark ZeroMe, should update ZeroMe the same?

I'm having such a hard time explaining the failures of the server-client paradigm to people; how centralization will provides a single point of failure - a fruit too delicious to evade attack - and how moving to a network of peer-to-peer hosting is the only next logical move.  I'm just greeted with general indifference and casual, lazy acceptance when I speak.

How do you tell someone that it's all poison, right down to the copper?  How to do you explain Room 641A and the Utah Datacenter to someone who doesn't even understand how their computer works?  How do you tell people that Facebook's move to OAuth provides a defacto identity authority?

I want to lower the bar of entry into systems like ZeroNet, perhaps not this one specifically (although, so far, I'm a huge fan) but just towards the decentralization in general.  Who had ideas on this?

It's always nerve-wracking to realize that you're crashing at a sell-house.  I think that the guy is using too, he's got the mood about it.  It's nothing against drugs, just people that suck at doing them.
Spent the day gathering intel.  Tedious work.
If I am to do time I will need to write, and somehow replace the social recognition of the work.  Or modify it to a periodical joy, should my soul bear that weight between words that matter.

there is a loneliness in this world so great
that you can see it in the slow movement of
the hands of a clock.

people so tired
mutilated
either by love or no love.

people just are not good to each other
one on one.

the rich are not good to the rich
the poor are not good to the poor.

we are afraid.

our educational system tells us
that we can all be
big-ass winners.

it hasn't told us
about the gutters
or the suicides.

or the terror of one person
aching in one place
alone

untouched
unspoken to

watering a plant.”

― Charles Bukowski, Love Is a Dog from Hell

The city is no place for a person.  The city is no place to live.  There are rats and brick cages, for too many.  How much I hate it here, with the spotlight birds and the endless corners.  The rats ask me to be impressed that they're big rats.  That they gnaw the largest chunks of refuse.  How badly I want this place to go up in some great fire, that the gods would throw the bread out entirely for such a spot of mold.

comment.body:
Oh I love it.  This is going to save my eyeballs.

Thank you @Jayofthezero.

We need to have decentralization parties, just like crypto parties, coupled with *nix install nights.  People who can help need to step up and help everyone else.

Also, random thought: looking at federated systems like StatusNet/GNUSocial/Mastodon, how would that work here on ZeroNet?  That seems like an ultimate goal.  Link ident auth with federated social.
